Class FloorPlanSystem.DisplayPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • FloorPlanSystem.DisplayPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    FloorPlanSystem
    private class FloorPlanSystem.DisplayPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    The main display JPanel for the floor plan. Draws all tables with students assigned. A Student who has accommodations is colored blue, and a student who has not paid yet is colored black. A table that is currently selected is orange.
    Version:
    1.0, 07/03/20
    Author:
    Charles Wong

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayPanel

        private DisplayPanel()
        The constructor for the display JPanel. Sets the background color, and adds a MouseListener to the panel. Additionally adds a ComponentAdapter as a component listener in order to listen to a resize event, which on triggered will recalculate Table positions and sizes.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Invokes super's paintComponent and draws all tables. On entering FloorPlanSystem this method will recalculate the arrangement of students as well as the positions and sizes of all tables.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - a Graphics object
        See Also:
        recalculate(boolean)

      • recalculate

        private void recalculate​(boolean calc)
        Calculates the positions and sizes of all Tables based on the number of tables and the screen size. The option to also calculate the arrangement of Students is also available.

        The table transforms are calculated in two steps. First, the radii of the tables are scaled to the smaller of the two axes. This ensures that all tables will fit on screen regardless of the size or dimensions of the window. Then every table's x and y coordinates are calculated using predetermined row lengths.

        Parameters:
        calc - a boolean to determine whether or not to calculate the arrangement of students into tables
        See Also:
        paintComponent(Graphics), FloorPlanSystem.SidePanel.SettingsPanel.propertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent)

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Invoked when a mouse button has been pressed on a component. If a Table is selected, that table is found and identified. It's corresponding information tree is built.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:

        See Also:
